etymology.description: Phonetic: 厂(厂) (chǎng, "cliff") + Semantic: 人(人) (rén, "person") + Semantic: 隹(隹) (zhuī, "short-tailed bird") = combination of elements suggesting sound and meaning of 'wild goose'
etymology.interpretation: The character 雁(yàn, 'wild goose') uses 厂(厂) (chǎng) as a phonetic component, suggesting sounds related to it, while 人(人) (rén) and 隹(隹) (zhuī) semantically strengthen the imagery of a bird in a natural setting, depicting a wild goose.

examples.chinese: 秋风送爽(秋風送爽)，大雁南飞(大雁南飛)。
examples.pinyin: qiū fēng sòng shuǎng, dà yàn nán fēi.
examples.english: When the autumn breeze blows, wild geese fly south.

examples.chinese: 夜色降临(夜色降臨)，孤雁远鸣(孤雁遠鳴)。
examples.pinyin: yè sè jiàng lín, gū yàn yuǎn míng.
examples.english: As night falls, a lone wild goose cries in the distance.
